field.name: summary
field.value: Add checks for Interfaces in SessionFactoryHolder.GetRootType(), to allow for more flexible database configuration

field.name: description
field.value:
Adds checks for any interfaces that this type may Implement, and checks those against the type2Conf Dictionary.
This allows for more flexible database configuration.
e.g.
My project started out not using generic ActiveRecordBase<>, then some models started to use generics. This works OK when there are not multiple databases. when multiple databases are used however, there is no single root parent between the generic & non-generic heirarchies. This causes the types (which were origionally associated with the same configuration) to be put in different Nhibernate.Cfg.Configuration's, even though they reference the same database, causing nhibernate mapping errors.
